skill.name: citation-management
skill.description: Comprehensive citation management for academic research. Search Google Scholar and PubMed for papers, extract accurate metadata, validate citations, and generate properly formatted BibTeX entries. This skill should be used when you need to find papers, verify citation information, convert DOIs to BibTeX, or ensure reference accuracy in scientific writing.
skill.summary: Comprehensive citation management for academic research. Search Google Scholar and PubMed for papers...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate academic citation management tool. All 1133 static findings are FALSE POSITIVEs. The tool makes legitimate API calls to academic services (CrossRef, PubMed, arXiv), reads credentials from environment variables (standard practice), and writes BibTeX files (expected functionality). No malicious behavior detected.

content.value_statement: Managing citations manually is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill automates searching academic databases, extracting metadata from DOIs and PMIDs, validating citations, and generating publication-ready BibTeX entries.
actual_capabilities: Search Google Scholar and PubMed with advanced filters
Extract metadata from DOI, PMID, arXiv ID, or URL
Generate and validate BibTeX entries automatically
Clean and format existing BibTeX files
limitations: Requires internet access for API calls to academic databases
Google Scholar search depends on third-party library availability
Does not integrate directly with reference managers like Zotero

best_practices: Always validate bibliographies before manuscript submission
Use DOIs instead of URLs for permanent citation links
Keep separate BibTeX files for different projects
anti_patterns: Manually typing BibTeX entries instead of using automated extraction
Ignoring validation warnings about broken DOIs
Using inconsistent citation key formats across a bibliography

faq.question: Do I need an API key for PubMed searches?
faq.answer: No, but NCBI recommends one for higher rate limits. Set NCBI_API_KEY environment variable.

faq.question: What citation styles are supported?
faq.answer: The tool generates standard BibTeX entries. Style formatting depends on your LaTeX document class.

faq.question: Can I use this with LaTeX documents?
faq.answer: Yes, export BibTeX files and include them with \bibliography{filename} in your document.

faq.question: How accurate is metadata extraction?
faq.answer: CrossRef and PubMed provide authoritative metadata. Always spot-check extracted entries against original papers.

faq.question: Does this work with arXiv papers?
faq.answer: Yes, the extract_metadata.py script supports arXiv IDs and queries the arXiv API.

faq.question: How do I find duplicate citations?
faq.answer: Run validate_citations.py with --check-duplicates flag or use format_bibtex.py with --deduplicate option.
